attributes.action: not make elderly people with recognised medical conditions pay for the residential element of their care in a  care home when they are  incapable of looking after themselves
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Surely it is totally unjust to make someone who suffers from dementia or Alzheimers pay for their residential care (if they have sufficient savings) when they have contributed with national insurance payments all their lives and suffer with a medical condition affecting their brain.
If they had been misfortunate enough to have had another medical condition, e.g. heart failure, would they have been expected to pay for a heart transplant? Surely the cost of this proceedure alone would be the equivalent of funding a long period in a care home? 

If they were a prisoner in jail for murder would they have to pay the "hotel" element of their imprisonment?
